snippet: If Iran decided to race for a nuclear weapon, would the West detect that in time to stop it? And even if it were detected, would an airstrike be the best option?
abstract: News analysis; Pres Obama and Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu, following White House meeting, remain divided on whether the US will detect an Iranian race for nuclear weapons in time to stop it militarily; US officials espouse confidence that such an operation is well within their means, while their Israeli counterparts remain skeptical, pointing to the less-than-stellar American record of predicting the emergence of nuclear powers.
lead_paragraph: If Iran decided to race for a nuclear weapon, would the West detect that in time to stop it? And even if it were detected, would an airstrike be the best option?

headline.seo: On Iran Nuclear Effort, 2 Questions Split U.S. and Israel
headline.main: On Iran, Questions of Detection and Response Divide U.S. and Israel
headline.print_headline: On Iran, Questions of Detection and Response Divide U.S. and Israel
